news_header: Sunandan Das, an Indian snake expert at the University of Helsinki, has a lifelong passion for snakes, including toxic species. He conducts research on reptile evolution and genetics, having made significant discoveries in the field.
news_text: Sunandan Das, originally from Kolkata, India, is a snake expert now working at the University of Helsinki. He has a deep passion for snakes, cultivated since childhood, and currently keeps several toxic snakes and a king boa at his residence. Das has been handling snakes since he was a boy, encouraged by his parents. He studied zoology and later pursued advanced research in Helsinki, where he has access to extensive resources for his work. His research has led to the discovery of a new tribe of snakes, Micrelapidae, which is a significant achievement in evolutionary biology. Das emphasizes the importance of biodiversity research in protecting reptiles, especially in light of climate change affecting their habitats.
